intro: Illecebrum pulverulentum, commonly known as the dusty illecebrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is generally considered a weed in agricultural settings.
